definition: to be too shy to speak one's mind (idiom)
shy/ashamed/shame/bashful/variant of 饈|馐[xiu1]/delicacies
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
tooth/CL:顆|颗[ke1]

sentences.english: China is a olutely right I'm ashamed to admit.
sentences.chinese: 羞于启齿，但我得承认，中国绝对是正确的。

sentences.english: China is absolutely right I'm ashamed to admit.
sentences.chinese: 羞于启齿，但我得承认，中国绝对是正确的。

sentences.english: Why are people ashamed of being single?
sentences.chinese: 为什么人们总是对单身羞于启齿呢？

sentences.english: He said other things I cannot speak out for shame.
sentences.chinese: 他还说了些我羞于启齿的话。

definition: to be too embarrassed to mention sth (idiom)/to find it hard to speak about sth
to open one's mouth/to start talking
embarrassed
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
a hidden trouble hard to mention (idiom)/sth too embarrassing to mention/an embarrassing illness
(a feeling of) shame
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
sex education
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions
an unmentionable illness (e.g. venereal disease)
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
no use to tell others/let's keep this between ourselves (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 zu2 wei2 wai4 ren2 dao4

definition: thin-skinned/sensitive
